intro: Plethiandra sahebii, commonly known as the Sahel plethiandra, is a flowering plant native to the Sahel region of Africa. It is a shrub that typically grows in dry, arid environments, adapting to harsh climatic conditions. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers, which are often fragrant. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, and it has a woody stem that allows it to survive in nutrient-poor soils. Plethiandra sahebii plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
